item.title: Large plastic sheets caught in trees, 7th December
item.description:
Large blue plastic sheets have been caught in trees on University road (A206) next to the river Darent. This road is littered with abandoned bits of rubbish, assuming it was originally part of flytipping and the wind has blown the litter into the trees and grass verge. As already mentioned if the CCTV could be re-installed on the opposite side of the road on the Darent river bridge, that should sort out the flytipping so the litter can now also be removed without further flytipping aggravating the issue.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On the bus stand for 208, 7th December
item.description:
This has been an issue for a considerable length of time I've reported numerous times and nothing is done. Today I was unable to get up the kirb at all and was forced to go around the 208 towards oncoming traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Hall Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scooter in a bush in Whitehall recreation ground, 7th December

item.title: Flytipping causing environmental hazard, 7th December
item.description:
These black bin bags have been here for some time and are creating an environmental hazard.Authorities should respond. A CCTV camera was once installed on the opposite side of the road and was a deterent for flytipping here. I notice that it has been removed. Why?

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verge destroyed, 7th December
item.description:
The grass verge has been destroyed again by a HGV parking illegally delivering or dropping off to a resident. No care at all just ripped up the whole thing completely and left a mess strewn all over the road and footpath. Bexley council really need to sort this out and stop people destroying things like this with no consequences.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellegrove Road, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
